alert.note: Alert for Crowley County Including Ordway; Huerfano County Including Walsenburg; Otero County Including La Junta and Western Comanche Grasslands; Pueblo County Including Pueblo; Western Las Animas County Including Trinidad and Thatcher (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 27 at 3:54AM MST until February 28 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A Red Flag Warning has been issued for portions of the I-25 corridor and parts of the eastern plains for Monday afternoon... ...A Fire Weather Watch has been issued for portions of the area for Tuesday afternoon... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228, 229, 230, 231, AND 232... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 228, 229, 230, 231, AND 232... The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday afternoon. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 228, 229, 230, 231 and 232. * Winds...West 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 13 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior. A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
